fields.name: import
fields.description:
Applies the specified JSON `spec` of `Restream`s to this server.

If `replace` is `true` then replaces all the existing `Restream`s with
the one defined by the `spec`. Otherwise, merges the `spec` with
existing `Restream`s.

### Result

Returns `null` if a `Restream` with the given `id` doesn't exist,
otherwise always returns `true`.

args.name: spec
args.description: JSON spec obtained with `export` query.

args.name: replace
args.description: Indicator whether the `spec` should replace existing definitions.

args.name: restreamId
args.description: Optional ID of a concrete `Restream` to apply the `spec` to without touching other `Restream`s.

fields.name: setRestream
fields.description:
Sets a new `Restream` or updates an existing one (if `id` is specified).

### Idempotency

Idempotent if `id` is specified. Otherwise is non-idempotent, always
creates a new `Restream` and errors on the `key` duplicates.

### Result

Returns `null` if a `Restream` with the given `id` doesn't exist,
otherwise always returns `true`.

args.name: key
args.description: Unique key to set the `Restream` with.

args.name: label
args.description: Optional label to set the `Restream` with.

args.name: src
args.description:
URL to pull a live stream from.

If not specified then `Restream` will await for a live stream being pushed to its endpoint.

args.name: backupSrc
args.description:
URL to pull a live stream from for a backup endpoint.

If not specified then `Restream` will await for a live stream being pushed to its backup endpoint.

Has no effect if `withBackup` argument is not `true`.

args.name: withBackup
args.description: Indicator whether the `Restream` should have a backup endpoint for a live stream.

args.name: withHls
args.description: Indicator whether the `Restream` should have an additional endpoint for serving a live stream via HLS.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of the `Restream` to be updated rather than creating a new one.

fields.name: removeRestream
fields.description:
Removes a `Restream` by its `id`.

### Result

Returns `null` if `Restream` with the given `id` doesn't exist,
otherwise always returns `true`.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of the `Restream` to be removed.

fields.name: enableRestream
fields.description:
Enables a `Restream` by its `id`.

Enabled `Restream` is allowed to accept or pull a live stream.

### Result

Returns `true` if a `Restream` with the given `id` has been enabled,
`false` if it has been enabled already, and `null` if it doesn't exist.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of the `Restream` to be enabled.

fields.name: disableRestream
fields.description:
Disables a `Restream` by its `id`.

Disabled `Restream` stops all on-going re-streaming processes and is not
allowed to accept or pull a live stream.

### Result

Returns `true` if a `Restream` with the given `id` has been disabled,
`false` if it has been disabled already, and `null` if it doesn't exist.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of the `Restream` to be disabled.

fields.name: enableInput
fields.description:
Enables an `Input` by its `id`.

Enabled `Input` is allowed to accept or pull a live stream.

### Result

Returns `true` if an `Input` with the given `id` has been enabled,
`false` if it has been enabled already, and `null` if it doesn't exist.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of the `Input` to be enabled.

args.name: restreamId
args.description: ID of the `Restream` to enable the `Input` in.

fields.name: disableInput
fields.description:
Disables an `Input` by its `id`.

Disabled `Input` stops all on-going re-streaming processes and is not
allowed to accept or pull a live stream.

### Result

Returns `true` if an `Input` with the given `id` has been disabled,
`false` if it has been disabled already, and `null` if it doesn't exist.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of the `Input` to be disabled.

args.name: restreamId
args.description: ID of the `Restream` to disable the `Input` in.

fields.name: setOutput
fields.description:
Sets a new `Output` or updates an existing one (if `id` is specified).

### Idempotency

Idempotent if `id` is specified. Otherwise is non-idempotent, always
creates a new `Output` and errors on the `dst` duplicates within the
specified `Restream`.

### Result

Returns `null` if a `Restream` with the given `restreamId` doesn't
exist, or an `Output` with the given `id` doesn't exist, otherwise
always returns `true`.

args.name: restreamId
args.description: ID of the `Restream` to add a new `Output` to.

args.name: dst
args.description:
Destination URL to re-stream a live stream onto.

At the moment only [RTMP] and [Icecast] are supported.

[Icecast]: https://icecast.org
[RTMP]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real-Time_Messaging_Protocol

args.name: label
args.description: Optional label to add a new `Output` with.

args.name: mixins
args.description: Optional `MixinSrcUrl`s to mix into this `Output`.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of the `Output` to be updated rather than creating a new one.

fields.name: removeOutput
fields.description:
Removes an `Output` by its `id` from the specified `Restream`.

### Result

Returns `null` if the specified `Restream`/`Output` doesn't exist,
otherwise always returns `true`.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of the `Output` to be removed.

args.name: restreamId
args.description: ID of the `Restream` to remove the `Output` from.

fields.name: enableOutput
fields.description:
Enables an `Output` by its `id` in the specified `Restream`.

Enabled `Output` starts re-streaming a live stream to its destination.

### Result

Returns `true` if an `Output` with the given `id` has been enabled,
`false` if it has been enabled already, and `null` if the specified
`Restream`/`Output` doesn't exist.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of the `Output` to be enabled.

args.name: restreamId
args.description: ID of the `Restream` to enable the `Output` in.

fields.name: disableOutput
fields.description:
Disables an `Output` by its `id` in the specified `Restream`.

Disabled `Output` stops re-streaming a live stream to its destination.

### Result

Returns `true` if an `Output` with the given `id` has been disabled,
`false` if it has been disabled already, and `null` if the specified
`Restream`/`Output` doesn't exist.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of the `Output` to be disabled.

args.name: restreamId
args.description: ID of the `Restream` to disable the `Output` in.

fields.name: enableAllOutputs
fields.description:
Enables all `Output`s in the specified `Restream`.

Enabled `Output`s start re-streaming a live stream to their
destinations.

### Result

Returns `true` if at least one `Output` has been enabled, `false` if all
`Output`s have been enabled already, and `null` if the specified
`Restream` doesn't exist.

args.name: restreamId
args.description: ID of the `Restream` to enable all `Output`s in.

fields.name: disableAllOutputs
fields.description:
Disables all `Output`s in the specified `Restream`.

Disabled `Output`s stop re-streaming a live stream to their
destinations.

### Result

Returns `true` if at least one `Output` has been disabled, `false` if
all `Output`s have been disabled already, and `null` if the specified
`Restream` doesn't exist.

args.name: restreamId
args.description: ID of the `Restream` to disable all `Output`s in.

fields.name: disableAllOutputsOfRestreams
fields.description:
Disables all `Output`s in all `Restream`s.

Disabled `Output`s stop re-streaming a live stream to their
destinations.

### Result

Returns `true` if at least one `Output` has been disabled, `false` if
all `Output`s have been disabled already or there are no outputs

fields.name: enablesAllOutputsOfRestreams
fields.description:
Enables all `Output`s in all `Restream`s.

Enabled `Output`s start re-streaming a live stream to their
destinations.

### Result

Returns `true` if at least one `Output` has been enabled, `false` if all
`Output`s have been enabled already or there are no outputs

fields.name: tuneVolume
fields.description:
Tunes a `Volume` rate of the specified `Output` or one of its `Mixin`s.

### Result

Returns `true` if a `Volume` rate has been changed, `false` if it has
the same value already, or `null` if the specified `Output` or `Mixin`
doesn't exist.

args.name: restreamId
args.description: ID of the `Restream` to tune the `Output` in.

args.name: outputId
args.description: ID of the tuned `Output`.

args.name: mixinId
args.description:
Optional ID of the tuned `Mixin`.

If set, then tunes the `Mixin` rather than the `Output`.

args.name: volume
args.description: Volume rate in percents to be set.

fields.name: tuneDelay
fields.description:
Tunes a `Delay` of the specified `Mixin` before mix it into its
`Output`.

### Result

Returns `true` if a `Delay` has been changed, `false` if it has the same
value already, or `null` if the specified `Output` or `Mixin` doesn't
exist.

args.name: restreamId
args.description: ID of the `Restream` to tune the the `Mixin` in.

args.name: outputId
args.description: ID of the `Output` of the tuned `Mixin`.

args.name: mixinId
args.description: ID of the tuned `Mixin`.

args.name: delay
args.description: Number of milliseconds to delay the `Mixin` before mix it into its `Output`.

fields.name: removeDvrFile
fields.description:
Removes the specified recorded file.

### Result

Returns `true` if the specified recorded file was removed, otherwise
`false` if nothing changes.

args.name: path
args.description:
Relative path of the recorded file to be removed.

Use the exact value returned by `Query.dvrFiles`.

fields.name: setPassword
fields.description:
Sets or unsets the password to protect this GraphQL API with.

Once password is set, any subsequent requests to this GraphQL API should
perform [HTTP Basic auth][1], where any username is allowed, but the
password should match the one being set.

### Result

Returns `true` if password has been changed or unset, otherwise `false`
if nothing changes.

[1]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication

args.name: new
args.description: New password to be set. In `null` then unsets the current password.

args.name: old
args.description: Old password for authorization, if it was set previously.

fields.name: setSettings
fields.description:
Sets settings of the server

### Result

Returns `false` if title does not pass validation for max allowed
characters length. Otherwise returns `true`

args.name: title
args.description: Title for the server

args.name: deleteConfirmation
args.description: Whether do we need to confirm deletion of inputs and outputs

args.name: enableConfirmation
args.description: Whether do we need to confirm enabling/disabling of inputs or outputs

types.name: Input
types.description: Upstream source that a `Restream` receives a live stream from.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
Unique ID of this `Input`.

Once assigned, it never changes.

fields.name: key
fields.description:
Key of this `Input` to expose its `InputEndpoint`s with for accepting
and serving a live stream.

fields.name: endpoints
fields.description:
Endpoints of this `Input` serving a live stream for `Output`s and
clients.

fields.name: src
fields.description:
Source to pull a live stream from.

If specified, then this `Input` will pull a live stream from it (pull
kind), otherwise this `Input` will await a live stream to be pushed
(push kind).

fields.name: enabled
fields.description:
Indicator whether this `Input` is enabled, so is allowed to receive a
live stream from its upstream sources.

types.name: Status
types.description: Status indicating availability of an `Input`, `Output`, or a `Mixin`.

enumValues.name: OFFLINE
enumValues.description: Inactive, no operations are performed and no media traffic is flowed.

enumValues.name: INITIALIZING
enumValues.description: Initializing, media traffic doesn't yet flow as expected.

enumValues.name: ONLINE
enumValues.description:
Active, all operations are performing successfully and media traffic
flows as expected.

types.name: InputEndpoint
types.description: Endpoint of an `Input` serving a live stream for `Output`s and clients.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
Unique ID of this `InputEndpoint`.

Once assigned, it never changes.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: Kind of this `InputEndpoint`.

fields.name: status
fields.description:
`Status` of this `InputEndpoint` indicating whether it actually serves a
live stream ready to be consumed by `Output`s and clients.

fields.name: info
fields.description: Returns the current `Info` parameters of this server.

fields.name: allRestreams
fields.description: Returns all the `Restream`s happening on this server.

fields.name: dvrFiles
fields.description:
Returns list of recorded files of the specified `Output`.

If returned list is empty, the there is no recorded files for the
specified `Output`.

Each recorded file is represented as a relative path on [SRS] HTTP
server in `dvr/` directory, so the download link should look like this:
```ignore
http://my.host:8080/dvr/returned/file/path.flv
```

[SRS]: https://github.com/ossrs/srs

args.name: id
args.description: ID of the `Output` to return recorded files of.

fields.name: export
fields.description:
Returns `Restream`s happening on this server and identifiable by the
given `ids` in an exportable JSON format.

If no `ids` specified, then returns all the `Restream`s happening on
this server at the moment.

args.name: ids
args.description:
IDs of `Restream`s to be exported.

If empty, then all the `Restream`s will be exported.

enumValues.name: RTMP
enumValues.description:
[RTMP] endpoint.

Can accept a live stream and serve it for playing.

[RTMP]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real-Time_Messaging_Protocol

enumValues.name: HLS
enumValues.description:
[HLS] endpoint.

Only serves a live stream for playing and is not able to accept one.

[HLS]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_Live_Streaming

types.name: Output
types.description: Downstream destination that a `Restream` re-streams a live stream to.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
Unique ID of this `Output`.

Once assigned, it never changes.

fields.name: dst
fields.description:
Downstream URL to re-stream a live stream onto.

At the moment only [RTMP] and [Icecast] are supported.

[Icecast]: https://icecast.org
[RTMP]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real-Time_Messaging_Protocol

fields.name: label
fields.description: Optional label of this `Output`.

fields.name: previewUrl
fields.description: Url of stream preview.

fields.name: volume
fields.description:
Volume rate of this `Output`'s audio tracks when mixed with
`Output.mixins`.

Has no effect when there is no `Output.mixins`.

fields.name: mixins
fields.description:
`Mixin`s to mix this `Output` with before re-streaming it to its
downstream destination.

If empty, then no mixing is performed and re-streaming is as cheap as
possible (just copies bytes "as is").

fields.name: enabled
fields.description:
Indicator whether this `Output` is enabled, so is allowed to perform a
live stream re-streaming to its downstream destination.

fields.name: status
fields.description:
`Status` of this `Output` indicating whether it actually re-streams a
live stream to its downstream destination.

types.name: FailoverInputSrc
types.description:
Failover source of multiple `Input`s to pull a live stream by an `Input`
from.

fields.name: inputs
fields.description:
`Input`s forming this `FailoverInputSrc`.

Failover is implemented by attempting to pull the first `Input` falling
back to the second one, and so on. Once the first source is restored,
we pool from it once again.

types.name: InputSrc
types.description: Source to pull a live stream by an `Input` from.

types.name: Mixin
types.description:
Additional source for an `Output` to be mixed with before re-streaming to
the destination.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
Unique ID of this `Mixin`.

Once assigned, it never changes.

fields.name: src
fields.description:
URL of the source to be mixed with an `Output`.

At the moment, only [TeamSpeak] is supported.

[TeamSpeak]: https://teamspeak.com

fields.name: volume
fields.description: Volume rate of this `Mixin`'s audio tracks to mix them with.

fields.name: delay
fields.description:
Delay that this `Mixin` should wait before being mixed with an `Output`.

Very useful to fix de-synchronization issues and correct timings between
a `Mixin` and its `Output`.

fields.name: status
fields.description:
`Status` of this `Mixin` indicating whether it provides an actual media
stream to be mixed with its `Output`.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description:
GraphQL type kind

The GraphQL specification defines a number of type kinds - the meta type of a type.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description:
## Scalar types

Scalar types appear as the leaf nodes of GraphQL queries. Strings, numbers, and booleans are the built in types, and while it's possible to define your own, it's relatively uncommon.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description:
## Object types

The most common type to be implemented by users. Objects have fields and can implement interfaces.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description:
## Interface types

Interface types are used to represent overlapping fields between multiple types, and can be queried for their concrete type.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description:
## Union types

Unions are similar to interfaces but can not contain any fields on their own.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description:
## Enum types

Like scalars, enum types appear as the leaf nodes of GraphQL queries.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description:
## Input objects

Represents complex values provided in queries _into_ the system.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description:
## List types

Represent lists of other types. This library provides implementations for vectors and slices, but other Rust types can be extended to serve as GraphQL lists.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description:
## Non-null types

In GraphQL, nullable types are the default. By putting a `!` after a type, it becomes non-nullable.

types.name: Info
types.description: Information about parameters that this server operates with.

fields.name: publicHost
fields.description:
Host that this server is reachable via in public.

Use it for constructing URLs to this server.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the server

fields.name: deleteConfirmation
fields.description: Whether do we need to confirm deletion of inputs and outputs

fields.name: enableConfirmation
fields.description: Whether do we need to confirm enabling/disabling of inputs or outputs

fields.name: passwordHash
fields.description:
[Argon2] hash of the password that this server's GraphQL API is
protected with, if any.

Non-`null` value means that any request to GraphQL API should perform
[HTTP Basic auth][1]. Any username is allowed, but the password should
match this hash.

[Argon2]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argon2
[1]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication

fields.name: passwordOutputHash
fields.description: Password hash for single output application

fields.name: info
fields.description: Subscribes to updates of `Info` parameters of this server.

fields.name: allRestreams
fields.description: Subscribes to updates of all `Restream`s happening on this server.

types.name: RemoteInputSrc
types.description: Remote upstream source to pull a live stream by an `Input` from.

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL of this `RemoteInputSrc`.

types.name: Restream
types.description: Re-stream of a live stream from one `Input` to many `Output`s.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
Unique ID of this `Input`.

Once assigned, it never changes.

fields.name: key
fields.description:
Unique key of this `Restream` identifying it, and used to form its
endpoints URLs.

fields.name: label
fields.description: Optional label of this `Restream`.

fields.name: input
fields.description: `Input` that a live stream is received from.

fields.name: outputs
fields.description: `Output`s that a live stream is re-streamed to.
